title: gazebo6 always crashes when adding a ROS camera plugin (libgazebo_ros_camera.so)

content.raw:
```

(gdb) bt
#0  0x00007ffff602f7ea in gazebo::sensors::Sensor::SetPose(ignition::math::Pose3<double> const&) () from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libgazebo_sensors.so.6
#1  0x00007fff78dfeb9d in gazebo::GazeboRosCameraUtils::LoadThread() () from /opt/ros/indigo/lib/libgazebo_ros_camera_utils.so
#2  0x00007ffff4b65a4a in ?? () from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libboost_thread.so.1.54.0
#3  0x00007ffff5790182 in start_thread (arg=0x7fff5af90700) at pthread_create.c:312
#4  0x00007ffff698f47d in clone () at ../sysdeps/unix/sysv/linux/x86_64/clone.S:111

How to reproduce:
- roslaunch gazebo_ros empty_world.launch
- Add any model with a libgazebo_ros_camera.so plugin, e.g.
        <plugin name="symbolic_camera_sensor_ros" filename="libgazebo_ros_camera.so">
          <alwaysOn>true</alwaysOn>
          <cameraName>/test_camera</cameraName>
          <imageTopicName>image</imageTopicName>
          <cameraInfoTopicName>camera_info</cameraInfoTopicName>
        </plugin>
- Watch gzserver crash


> apt-cache showpkg gazebo6 ros-indigo-gazebo6-ros
Package: gazebo6
Versions: 
6.3.0-1~trusty (/var/lib/apt/lists/packages.osrfoundation.org_gazebo_ubuntu_dists_trusty_main_binary-amd64_Packages) (/var/lib/dpkg/status)
 Description Language: 
                 File: /var/lib/apt/lists/packages.osrfoundation.org_gazebo_ubuntu_dists_trusty_main_binary-amd64_Packages
                  MD5: 26b15a71d5e6e4216797a28a5e62334b

Package: ros-indigo-gazebo6-ros
Versions: 
2.4.9-0trusty (/var/lib/apt/lists/packages.osrfoundation.org_gazebo_ubuntu_dists_trusty_main_binary-amd64_Packages) (/var/lib/dpkg/status)
 Description Language: 
                 File: /var/lib/apt/lists/packages.osrfoundation.org_gazebo_ubuntu_dists_trusty_main_binary-amd64_Packages
                  MD5: a0fe2eda142ee570084ca78697daef18

```

How to reproduce:

- Add any model with a libgazebo_ros_camera.so plugin, e.g.

          <alwaysOn>true</alwaysOn>
          <cameraName>/test_camera</cameraName>
          <imageTopicName>image</imageTopicName>
          <cameraInfoTopicName>camera_info</cameraInfoTopicName>
